title: Slow-Cooked Pulled Pork Sandwiches
directions:
1 Lightly season the pork with salt and pepper. Place
in a slow cooker insert, add the barbecue sauce, and
cover. Cook on low until the pork is fork-tender, 8-9
hours.

2 Skim off any fat from the sauce surface. Transfer
the pork to a carving board. Let stand for 5 minutes.
Using two forks, shred the pork, discarding any excess
fat. Return to the slow cooker.

3 Heap the meat and sauce onto the buns and serve
hot.
Adapted from Diamond Dishes by Julie Loria (Lyons Press/ $295) Excerpts copyright 2011 by Julie Loria, with permission of Lyons Press
ingredients: 1 3 1/2-pound boneless pork shoulder or butt roast, rind and excess fat trimmed
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 18-22-ounce bottles of your favorite barbecue sauce
